WRITING.TITLE: And my first ever random shiny is...

WRITING.TEXT: Actually, if you read the text, it says "you are able to capture every legendary pokemon." If you also watch the video this is shown it, the announcer explicitly says "if you have either Alpha Sapphire or Omega Ruby, you can encounter all legendaries." No need to jump to conclusions.

Yup. Here are the variations in different countries. http://imgur.com/gallery/qM5iw

iirc, Justice has the same system where they don't credit the singers or collaborators on their records. It has to do with the idea that they want these people to be a part of Justice, and that they weren't just tacked on for a song or two.
If Chilly released this medley I would buy 10 copies and send it to people. Also needs Thomas on the bass drum.
If anything, it sounds slightly similar to the melody of Indo Silver Club

WRITING.TITLE: HAA Remixes Released in the US!

WRITING.TEXT: Translates to "everyone...please be calm" for anyone wondering.
I was thinking Prime Time of Your Life. That whole intro...yeaaah, yeah, yeah
And all this time I thought they used a vocoder and were saying "yeah."

On the line of theories, I personally think the plot revolves around the morality of government, racism/human warfare, and humanity losing it's title of "top of the food chain." The idea of livestock is interesting, but considering real world factors, the main problems are that 1. People control their livestock extremely well 2. We are the ones that contain the livestock, not the livestock defending themselves, and 3. Livestock does not come back to fight and kill us.

WRITING.TITLE: This song is very much inspired by Le Knight Club, as well as DP's vocoder

WRITING.TEXT: While this an interesting take, I think the phrase "game of love" is a motif many artists and people have used.
